column2: MISSISSIPPI DMV WRITTEN TEST
column6: MS

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are not allowed to park here.
column6: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column8: you must display a special permit in order to park here.

column2: 2. If you meet a stopped school bus with the lights flashing and the signal arm extended, you should:
column4: watch for children and proceed at normal speed.
column6: proceed at 15 MPH or less, if no children are present.

column2: 3. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column6: pay close attention to the turn signals.
column8: cut abruptly in front of it.

column2: 4. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column6: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.

column2: 5. When driving on gravel roads:
column4: your tires do not have as much traction.
column6: you should keep your eyes moving.
column8: you should use cruise control to increase traction.

column2: 6. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column6: must obey

column2: 7. This sign means:
column6: Hairpin corner ahead.

column2: 8. When the road is slippery, you should:
column4: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.
column6: brake suddenly carefully.

column2: 9. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column6: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column8: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column6: Turn left at the intersection

column2: 12. Fatigue increases the risk of:
column6: hitting a roadblock.

column2: 13. This sign means:
column6: Parking is not allowed.

column2: 14. Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
column6: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.
column8: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.

column2: 15. When you are angry or upset you should:
column4: drive fast to let off steam.
column6: listen to loud music while driving.
column8: take a few minutes to cool off before you drive.

column2: 16. If one of your tires blows out while driving, you should:
column6: hold the steering wheel firmly, slow down, and steer smoothly.
column8: apply the brakes firmly and steer toward the right edge of the road.

column2: 17. Blocking an intersection during rush hour traffic is not permitted:
column4: unless you entered the intersection on a green light.
column6: under any circumstances.

column2: 18. These are:
column6: miles-left signs.

column2: 19. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column6: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.
column8: having them checked by a mechanic.

column2: 20. Before passing a vehicle or changing lanes, remember to:
column4: only pass or change lanes if the change can be completed  without speeding.
column6: signal your return to the left lane.
column8: sound your horn as you pass.

column2: 21. Drivers should always be looking:
column4: beside, ahead and to the rear of the vehicle.
column6: directly in front of the car.

column2: 22. You are driving at night, and a vehicle comes toward you with their high beam headlights on. You should:
column6: look in the direction of the vehicle.

column2: 23. The sign in the picture:
column4: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column6: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column8: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.

column2: 24. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column6: Never depend on

column2: 25. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column6: wait until the red lights stop flashing.
column8: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 26. In rainy weather, drivers should be most careful when turning or stopping:
column4: when it's been raining all day.
column6: after it has been raining for at least two hours.
column8: during the first half hour of rain.

column2: 27. When approaching an intersection with a traffic control signal that is not working, drivers should:
column4: try not to stop if the intersection is clear.
column6: stop as you would if there were stop signs in all directions, yield the right-of-way, then enter the intersection.
column8: speed up and proceed through the intersection.

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column6: Sharp curve ahead

column2: 29. Which of the following factors affect the absorption of alcohol?
column6: Your weight.

column2: 30. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column6: vehicles from the left.
